extraction_metadata.notes: This is a remarkably detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony. The case centers on property disputes (especially retraite/land buyback), selective hail damage to crops, and a prior accusation by an executed witch. Key features: (1) No prior reputation for witchcraft before Noel Purel's accusation; (2) Most suspicions arose retroactively after naming; (3) Evidence largely circumstantial based on crop protection patterns and property disputes; (4) Accused maintained innocence throughout, even under substantial torture; (5) Released due to insufficient evidence. This is one of the survival cases mentioned in the project documentation. The trial shows importance of community consensus, quality of evidence, and possibly defendant's social standing (laboureur, defended reputation, owned significant property).
